ygData.subject: Re: [Bug?] Cantera & pylab don't want to work together

Hmm. This works on my system.

Just a wild guess, but could Cantera and pyl=
ab use different versions
of Numpy?

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "kast_=
fr" <kast.fr@...> wrote:
>
> Hello all,
> 
> Can anyone explain me why this=
 little script doesn't work:
> 
> from Cantera import *
> import pylab
> 
>=
 g=3DIdealGasMix('gri30.cti')
> g.set(T =3D 300.0, P =3D OneAtm, X =3D 'CH4=
:0.95,O2:2,N2:7.52')
> g.equilibrate('HP')
> print g
> 
> while this one wo=
rks perfectly well (which is the same script except
> that the pylab librar=
y import was commented):
> from Cantera import *
> #import pylab
> 
> g=3DI=
dealGasMix('gri30.cti')
> g.set(T =3D 300.0, P =3D OneAtm, X =3D 'CH4:0.95,=
O2:2,N2:7.52')
> g.equilibrate('HP')
> print g
> 
> Is it some kind of bug =
or something else (I'm just a python beginner).
> Stef
>
